docs.title: CVE Records
docs.text:
The following Common Vulnerability and Exploit records are subject to GeoCat Coordinated Vulnerability disclosure policy. GeoCat works with our customers, the open source community, and security researchers worldwide.

Note

Use the Search field above to quickly explore CVE records.

docs.title: Free and Open Source
docs.text:
GeoCat products and services are built using a wide variety of technologies from communities and vendors.

The following CVE records are of interest to GeoCat customers, either directly affecting our products, or subject to assessment due to widespread publicity.

This documentation contains the following topics:

  • PostgreSQL and PostGIS

    PostgreSQL Database and extensions including PostGIS

  • Spring

    Spring Framework and Spring Boot Java Environment.

docs.title: CVE 2021 44228
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2021-12-09: Log4j2 Remote Code Execution CVE-2021-44228 vulnerability patch for GeoNetwork Enterprise

A zero-day exploit affecting the popular Apache Log4j2 utility (CVE-2021-44228) was made public on December 9, 2021 that results in remote code execution (RCE).

Evaluation:

GeoCat Live mapping services are not subject to this vulnerability.

GeoCat Live catalogue services are subject to this vulnerability, and have been updated (see mitigation below).

Mitigation:

GeoCat Live catalogue services were patched with an emergency "hotfix", removing the JndiLookup.class class to mitigate the issue as described in CVE-2021-44228.

The vulnerability relies on using JNDI to contact an LDAP service, by removing JndiLookup.class this vulnerability is mitigated.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live catalogue services updated to GeoServer Enterprise 2020.5.6-1, which makes use of the Apache Log4j 2.17.0 library not subject to this vulnerability.

Reference:

  • CVE-2021-44228
  • CVE-2021-45046

docs.title: CVE 2022 1552
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

CVE-2022-1552: Autovacuum, REINDEX, and others omit "security restricted operation" sandbox

Evaluation:

This issue affects GeoCat Live 2022.4 and earlier.

PostgreSQL reports: "An attacker having permission to create non-temp objects in at least one schema could execute arbitrary SQL functions under a superuser identity."

Mitigation:

Organizations providing staff with VPN access to their GeoCat Live PostgreSQL instance may choose to limit access until this issue is resolved.

PostgreSQL recommendation:

While promptly updating PostgreSQL is the best remediation for most users, a user unable to do that can work around the vulnerability by disabling autovacuum, not manually running the above commands (REINDEX, CREATE INDEX, REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW, CLUSTER, and pg_amcheck), and not restoring from output of the pg_dump command. Performance may degrade quickly under this workaround. VACUUM is safe, and all commands are fine when a trusted user owns the target object.

Resolution:

Resolved in GeoCat Live 2022.5 update to PostgreSQL 13.8.

Reference:

  • CVE-2022-1552: Autovacuum, REINDEX, and others omit "security restricted operation" sandbox

docs.title: CVE 2022 24818
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2022-04-11: Unchecked JNDI lookups in GeoTools

Evaluation:

A Java JNDI Deserialization vulnerability has been found in GeoServer when configuring:

  • Data stores using JNDI
  • Disk Quota for GeoWebCache
  • JDBC user/role providers

Mitigation:

None required, services have been patched.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live mapping services were patched with update 2022.2.

Reference:

  • GHSA-jvh2-668r-g75x
  • CVE-2022-24818

docs.title: CVE 2024 3094
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-04-02: xz-utils results in a backdoor in sshd

Evaluation:

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked against this library, intercepting and modifying the data interaction with this library.

Mitigation:

None required, the Ubuntu OS used in GeoCat Live or other GeoCat systems have not been affected.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live is not affected by the vulnerability.

The affected version of xz-utils and liblzma5 was only in noble-proposed, and was removed before migrating to noble itself. No released versions of Ubuntu were affected by this issue.

Reference:

CVE-2024-3094

docs.title: CVE 2024 6387
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-07-02: regreSSHion: Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH server

Evaluation:

On July 1, 2024, a new OpenSSH unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability dubbed regreSSHion was reported, affecting glibc-based Linux systems. This vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code as root due to a signal handler race condition in sshd.

This vulnerability, if exploited, could lead to full system compromise, where an attacker can execute arbitrary code with the highest privileges, resulting in a complete system takeover, installation of malware, data manipulation, and the creation of backdoors for persistent access. It could facilitate network propagation, allowing attackers to use a compromised system as a foothold to traverse and exploit other vulnerable systems within the organization.

Mitigation:

The Ubuntu OS used in GeoCat Live or other GeoCat systems have been updated with the packages that the Linux distribution released before the disclosure. In addition SSH ports are not publicly open and can only be connected from certain IP addresses.

Resolution:

OpenSSH server and client where updated to versions that contain the patch to fix this vulnerability.

Reference:

CVE-2024-6387

Qualys blog post
